page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF EASTERN COVENTRY
page.content: 55% of the area is suburban ;45% is the rural fringe beyond the city boundary including intensively farmed pasture,drained by the Sowe,and the woodland and pool of Coombe Park.Much of this open land will disappear from 1986 under the Eastern By-Pass and expected new development. The suburban area was formerly two villages,Wyken,an old mining community,and Walsgrave,a former wool producing centre.Evidence of former times includes Caludon Castle.Inter- war ribbon development along the A46,was followed by large scale, post-war infilling. The area today contains mainly middle- class housing,12 Primary and 2 Comprehensive schools,a college,large hospital,2 hypermarkets,small shopping centres and a modern industrial estate.
